result.execSummary:
Shaun M Smith was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Shaun M Smith was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaun M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Keith David O'Donnell in court.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
Defendant has been extradited. The State moves to dismiss

BTC: dismissed

Defendant Shaun M Smith in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Shaun M Smith in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
There was a mix up in Cook County so deft has not been picked up. Defense asks that deft be released so he can go to Cook County and take care of this matter.

BTC: The Court denies defense motion.

Defendant Shaun M Smith in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Shaun M Smith in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
State of Ilinois req extradition.
Defendant does not contest. Defendant DSAT.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.  Review hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
